<title level="1" pfs="Limited">[False Priest](/NPCs.aspx?ID=928)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Belief is perhaps the strongest force in the universe, driving many to great heights. Instilling a sense of belief and then using that belief against someone, however, is the discipline of a false priest. Combining their gifts of deception, a silver tongue, and an impeccable sense of timing, the false priest can gain influence among the powerful, entice a mark to dispose of all their possessions, and make a believer out of a cynic.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 19

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 4">[False Priest](/NPCs.aspx?ID=928)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Human" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=90" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=91" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gamemastery Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=22) pg. 229</row>

**Perception** +10

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +10, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +8, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +12, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) +12, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +8, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +6

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +0

**Dex** +4

**Con** +3

**Int** +0

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +4
</row>

**Items**
[alchemical tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2) (used as "blessed items" to fool marks), [Backpack](/Equipment.aspx?ID=4), cloak, [Hand Crossbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=69) (20 bolts), collection of fake relics, [wooden religious symbol](/Equipment.aspx?ID=41), [Studded Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=5), [Rapier](/Weapons.aspx?ID=36)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 21 

**Fort** +11 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +10 

</row>

**HP** 51

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
rapier +12 ([deadly 1d8](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)),
**Damage** 1d6+8 piercing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
hand crossbow +12 ([range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1d6+4 piercing

**Deceiver's Surprise**   On the first round of combat, if the false priest rolls [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) or [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) for initiative, creatures that haven't acted yet are [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) to the false priest.

**Fickle Prophecy** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) The false priest convinces someone of their omnipotence by attempting a [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) check compared to the creature's Will DC. If successful, the target gains 1d8+4 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 hour or until the false priest removes them by rebuking the target, whichever occurs first.

**[Sneak Attack](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=34)**   The false priest deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) creatures. This increases to 2d6 against creatures flat-footed due to the false priest's [Feint](/Actions.aspx?ID=48) or deceiver's surprise.

**The Jig Is Up** <actions string="Reaction" />  **Frequency** once per hour; **Trigger** The false priest critically fails a [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) or [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) check; **Effect** The false priest Strides.

</column>
